abstract: Stocks rose on Thursday as speculation that a jobs report on Friday would bolster optimism in the economy overshadowed concern about slowing growth in China, Bloomberg News reported.
snippet: Stocks rose on Thursday as speculation that a jobs report on Friday would bolster optimism in the economy overshadowed concern about slowing growth in China, Bloomberg News reported.
lead_paragraph: Stocks rose on Thursday as speculation that a jobs report on Friday would bolster optimism in the economy overshadowed concern about slowing growth in China, Bloomberg News reported.

headline.main: Hopeful Outlook on Jobs Gives the Market a Lift

abstract: Ulta Salon Cosmetics & Fragrance said Thursday that its chief executive, Lyn Kirby, and entities and individuals associated with Global Retail Partners are publicly offering just under 9.8 million shares of Ulta common stock, The Associated Press reported.
snippet: Ulta Salon Cosmetics & Fragrance said Thursday that its chief executive, Lyn Kirby, and entities and individuals associated with Global Retail Partners are publicly offering just under 9.8 million shares of Ulta common stock, The Associated Press ...
lead_paragraph: Ulta Salon Cosmetics & Fragrance said Thursday that its chief executive, Lyn Kirby, and entities and individuals associated with Global Retail Partners are publicly offering just under 9.8 million shares of Ulta common stock, The Associated Press reported.

headline.main: Ulta Salon Investors Announce Share Offering

abstract: A jury decided not to impose punitive damages against Wells Fargo on Thursday, a day after those jurors awarded $29.9 million to four nonprofits after finding the bank had breached its fiduciary duty and engaged in fraud.
snippet: A jury decided not to impose punitive damages against Wells Fargo on Thursday, a day after those jurors awarded $29.9 million to four nonprofits after finding the bank had breached its fiduciary duty and engaged in fraud.
lead_paragraph: A jury decided not to impose punitive damages against Wells Fargo on Thursday, a day after those jurors awarded $29.9 million to four nonprofits after finding the bank had breached its fiduciary duty and engaged in fraud.

headline.main: Wells Fargo Jury Decides Against Punitive Damages
